amendment.description: Amendment sought to prohibit warrantless searches of government databases for the communications of U.S. persons and to prohibit government agencies from mandating data security vulnerabilities in products or services for surveillance purposes.
amendment.purpose: An amendment No. 31 printed in House Report 114-623 to prohibit warrantless searches of government databases for the communications of U.S. persons and prohibits government agencies from mandating data security vulnerabilities in products or services for surveillance purposes.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Massie amendment (A030) Failed by recorded vote: 198 - 222 (Roll no. 321).

action.text: Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Massie amendment (A030) Failed by recorded vote: 198 - 222 (Roll no. 321).
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A030) offered by Mr. Massie.
